name: SpringHill Suites by Marriott Tarrytown Greenburgh

reviews.title: Nice new property
reviews.text: I have stayed here on several occasions as my company's main office is just down the street. I travel 100+ nights a year and stay almost exclusively in Marriott-brand properties.

My fiancé and I stayed for two nights over the Memorial Day Weekend as a base for seeing the many historic houses in the area. We were in a standard King room, which is described as a “studio suite”. The total square footage is not large, but the space is very well used.
reviews.title: Great Hotel for Historic Hudson
Great stay
reviews.text: There was a livingroom area with a sofa, chair and two tables that combine as a coffee table. Adjoining the livingroom was a work area with a desk and office chair and a kitchenette with a sink, refrigerator, microwave and coffee maker. The bedroom area was separated from the living room by a small partition. It should be noted that, both my fiancé and I thought the bed was extremely comfortable. The television did double duty; it was placed on stand with a pivot between the livingroom and bedroom was it could be watched in either. The bathroom was a nice size and the sink was outside. None of the areas were large, but they were big enough to suit their purposes and nicely decorated. The room also included free wireless internet. While the design is “cookie-cutter”, anyone looking for a comfortable place to sleep and relax with many amenities for a reasonable price should look no further.

A complimentary “extended-continental” breakfast is included, which in addition to the usual bagels and English muffins, included the fixings for egg and sausage sandwiches and a two machines to make-your-own waffle.
reviews.title: Perfect Home Away from Home
Great Affordable Place!
reviews.text: A word of advise about the peculiarities of this particular hotel. The hotel is built on a hillside, with the lobby and street level on the third floor. The swimming pool, hot tub and fitness center were on the second floor along with a lower level lot for additional parking. I would recommend asking for a room above the third floor.

The location of the hotel is perfect for exploring the area. Lyndhurst, Sunnyside, Philipsburg Manor, Kykuit (Rockefeller Estate) and Union Church are no more than ten minutes away. Driving to the center of Tarrytown took no longer than five minutes and there was plenty of parking in the municipal lot that comes up after you cross Main Street on Broadway (Route 9). In Tarrytown, there are plenty of terrific restaurants at which to eat and antique shops along Main Street and Broadway . Please note on the way back to the hotel from Tarrytown, you need to jug-handle on the right to make the left back onto White Plains Road for the hotel.
reviews.title: Excellent Choice for Reasonable Money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here on a Saturday night. It was our second or third time here but we hadn't been back in the past year. The rooms no longer look "new." The quality of the linens, pillows, and beds is poor--they are still using the Jamison brand mattresses that we thought Marriott had abandoned because they are so far inferior to every other chain hotel. Our room was particularly small this time. To call it a "suite" is ludicrous. The furniture was much too big for the size of the room. It was also laughable (sadly) that this was a "handicapped" room because it was certainly difficult to negotiate your away around the furniture even without mechanical assistance. A wheelchair would have fit in the bathroom but nowhere else. On the positive side, the breakfast was surprisingly good and the entire hotel was quite clean. All in all, if the price had been $30 less than the $139 rate we were paying, we would not have had much to complain about. At the actual rate, however, this was not a good value and was about what we would expect of a Comfort Inn.
reviews.title: No Great Shakes

likes.disliked: — Terrible beds, pillows, and linens and small room with big furniture

reviews.title: Great Hotel!
reviews.text: I spent one night at this hotel and loved it so much that I was sorry to leave the next day. The hotel was clean, attractive, friendly, and full of amenities.
We had a great 3 day stay. Used the hotel as a jumping off point to tour NYC and the area.
reviews.title: No complaints!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We liked the smaller size hotel and the suite room (complete with ref, micro, sink and sitting room).
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at this hotel in Tarrytown for 1 night and loved the experience.
reviews.title: Clean-New-Spacious-Good Service!

likes.disliked: — Hear footsteps through ceiling - thin ceiling!

reviews.text: Checkout was lightning quick and the front-desk team accommodated our advance checkout despite the fact it was a busy weekend and it was not even the checkout deadline 12'Noon for the prior day's guests.
reviews.title: It's just ok

likes.disliked: — Staff did not provide sheets or blankets for our daughter's bed

reviews.text: Great location 1.5 blocks East of I-87 exit.
reviews.title: You are Better Off at the Westchester Marriott

likes.liked: — Free web service, pretty good breakfast (lots of choices)
likes.disliked: — Cheap beds and bed linens, showing wear leading to lower comfort

reviews.text: You're looking at a 45mins daytime drive into Manhattan (not during peak rush hour periods of course) and approximately a 20mins drive in the late evening/night.
reviews.title: Disappointed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are spacious because they're suites (pretty sure they only have suites) with a sitting area, kitchen, small fridge, standard coffee maker and microwave.
reviews.title: Very clean hotel

likes.disliked: — there wasn't anything I did not like

aka: Springhill Suites By Marriott Tarrytown Greenburgh Hotel
description: Newly renovated all suite hotel in Westchester County. Relax in one of our new fresh suites and enjoy a cocktail in our new Lobby Bar. We offer free high speed internet (WI-FI), Indoor heated pool, shuttle service within 5 mile radius and complimentary full hot breakfast buffet.
